oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Wandering throughout South America: Taxonomic revision of Tradescantia subg. Austrotradescantia (D.R.Hunt) M.Pell. (Commelinaceae)
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: O. O. Pellegrini, Marco
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Commelinales
invasive species
Tradescantia fluminensis
Tradescantieae
Tradescantiinae
Tradescantia hertweckii
Commelinaceae
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: <jats:p>I present the first taxonomic revision for T.subg.Austrotradescantia, based on extensive field, cultivation and herbaria studies. I accept 13 species, three of them (i.e. <jats:italic>T.atlantica</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>T.hertweckii</jats:italic> and <jats:italic>T.tucumanensis</jats:italic>) being described as new in the present study. I provide an identification key to the species, distribution maps, descriptions, comments, conservation assessments and illustrations for all species. The troublesome weed <jats:italic>T.fluminensis</jats:italic> has its specific limits clarified and its native range is presented so it can serve as a basis to better understanding its ecological requirements and to help control it throughout its invasive range. Furthermore, I highlight that <jats:italic>T.mundula</jats:italic>, a commonly neglected species closely related to <jats:italic>T.fluminensis</jats:italic>, might also represent a troublesome weed. <jats:italic>Tradescantiamundula</jats:italic> has been widely introduced in cultivation under the name <jats:italic>T.albiflora</jats:italic> and seems to have also escaped from cultivation. However, due to the hitherto poorly understood specific limits of <jats:italic>T.fluminensis</jats:italic>, <jats:italic>T.mundula</jats:italic> has been treated as a mere cultivar of <jats:italic>T.fluminensis</jats:italic> <jats:italic>s.s.</jats:italic></jats:p>
